title: All peripherals turn off, computer freezes, only in menu
body:
let me give you a brief summary on events leading up to my problem; stopped playing league in late 2014, game remained on my computer unopened and unupdated, day before yesterday i went to update game and get back into league, patch wouldn't work after i did the 33% fix. uninstalled league all together and all the registry files (league was installed on my boot drive originally SSD). I reinstalled league on my 2nd HDD i use for all my games now. so now league is installed just like all the rest of my games to my 2nd hard drive, client has been downloaded, everything seems to be working as normal... then...

PROBLEM - 

AT RANDOM! looking through the runes, champions, clicking around, looking at gifts, literally anything on the menu, and at random, my 3 monitors will turn off and go into standby mode, keyboard turns off, mouse turns off, all peripherals become bricked, the pc is running and can not turn off when pressing the power button. I need to hard reset and turn off the psu. after computer boots back up, it runs like it never even had a problem...

- computer has never crashed like this before, EVER.

- computer does not crash when playing other games such as civ 6, csgo, killing floor, h1z1. this is only happening for league of legends.

- it literally happens randomly, its happend 8 times since i got my league running, cannot pinpoint further, it only happens on the menu when im clicking around threw the tabs, it does not happen when in game or champion select or anywhere besides in the menu.

- when loading into matches my whole computer lags like crazy, discord audio becomes choppy/fragmented, mouse is super slow and 1-2 seconds behind when i move it. after the game loadin screen appears the lag stops, it only happens for around 30 seconds

- yes i can play matches, without any problems after the lag when loading into the game

i built my pc in 2014 here are the specs:
amd fx8350 processor 
gigabyte gtx970 g1 gaming gpu 
ripjaw 1866 ddr3 ram 
gigabyte 990fxa-ud3 motherboard 
rosewill lighting 800w psu 
samsung evo 840 250gb ssd 
western digital caviar black 1 tb HDD 
kracken x61 water block with double rad cooler 

I also have the latest GeForce game ready drivers: 
Version	375.63 - WHQL

I am also on Windows 10 64bit

After all my googling and searching for a topic, i am finally posting on here because i cant find anybody who has experienced this problem.

if this would have happened 1 time outside of the league client, i would know its a problem with my computer and not a league of legends issue, but its only in the menu after I log in... what in the menu could be tripping up my computer and causing it to crash like this at random when selecting things?

replies.body:
I suspect there may be a program running in the background that could either causing this or at least exacerbating it. I recommend [performing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) to ensure no background apps are causing things to go south.
____
Let me know if that clean boot caused any change.

> Let me know if that clean boot caused any change.

Unfortunately this did not help. 

but I believe I have somewhat pinpointed the cause, when monitoring my resource values, the game Is crashing after clicking on new tabs or any button that requires a decent chunk of network activity to load the information from the next page/tab. crashes happen when activity spikes, no other time but then. CPU usage is low, disk is fine, memory checks out OK as well, but the only trend i see is the network spikes the second of crashing.

is there a way to limit the amount of network resources that lolclient.exe is allowed to draw from? or would there be a newer driver for my computer that might stop this "spike" from occurring? how would you approach this? any way for the client to show the crashes in logs somehow?

Hmm.. There may be certain network settings that could cause a bottleneck in your network throughput, causing this crash. I think in this case, I would be sure that your network configurations on your local network match what we suggest in [this guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if you observe any change as a result of those steps.

[SOLVED] 

fixed the issue, if you have a gtx970 or any 9 series card you installed on windows 7/8, and your computer is now running windows 10, you need to go to your GPU Manufacture's website and download the Windows 10 drivers for your card. yes, i may had the latest geforce drivers, and been all up to date on GeForce Experience, but i still needed to uninstall all my graphics drivers and reinstall the windows 10 ones.

1. download a display driver uninstaller and put it on your desktop.

2. download your manufacturers newest Geforce drivers for your operating system and put on desktop. (mine was windows 10)

3. run uninstaller to remove all GeForce drivers on your system (this should automatically restarts your computer)

4. once your signed back into your computer, install manufactures GeForce drivers (this will install newest GeForce Experience)

5. launch league of legends and enjoy not having the client crash on you :D
